mdRecord.dcterms:title: WSLS-TV reporter Bill Walker interviews NASCAR drivers Donnie Allison and Tiny Lund at Martinsville Speedway in Ridgeway, Va.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A reporter interviews NASCAR competitors Donnie Allison and Tiny Lund at the Martinsville Speedway. Donnie Allison discusses his rivalry with brother Bobby Allison. Tiny Lund lists luck, a good pit crew, and a good driver as the recipe to success at the Martinsville 500-lap race. Lund also describes his sports injuries from extensive racing. Modified cars speed around the track during a 100-lap race. Footage shows the top three finishers among the modified cars: the 1937 Chevrolet driven by Ray Hendrick and the 1936 Chevrolets driven by Ron Harris and Perk Brown.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Automobiles, Racing
Automobile racing drivers
